problems.title: Insert Node at Specific Position in SLL
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to insert a new node with value X at position P (1-based index). After insertion, display the final list. If P is greater than the list length + 1, ignore the operation. If the list is empty after operations, print -1.

Time Complexity
Building the list takes O(N), and insertion at a specific position takes O(N) due to traversal.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains two integers P (position) and X (value to insert).

Output Format
Print the elements of the updated linked list separated by spaces. If list becomes empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
3 99
Output:
10 20 99 30 40 50
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)

problems.title: Delete Node at Specific Position in SLL
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to delete the node at position P (1-based index) and then display the remaining list. If P is greater than the length of the list, ignore the deletion. If the list becomes empty, print -1.

Time Complexity
Deleting a node at a specific position requires traversal, resulting in O(N) complexity.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains an integer P (position to delete).

Output Format
Print the updated linked list elements separated by space. If list becomes empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
3
Output:
10 20 40 50
Explanation: Delete node at position 3 and display the updated list.
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Position P is >= 1
Values may be negative or positive
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)

problems.title: Convert SLL to CLL and Display
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to convert the SLL into a Circular Linked List (CLL) by connecting the last node to the head node. After conversion, display the list elements starting from head and stopping when head is reached again. If the list is empty, print -1.

Time Complexity
Building the list takes O(N), converting to CLL takes O(1), and displaying takes O(N).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the circular linked list elements separated by space. If the list is empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
Output:
10 20 30 40 50
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)

problems.title: Insert Node in Doubly Linked List (DLL)
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Doubly Linked List (DLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to insert a new node with value X at position P (1-based index). After insertion, display the updated DLL.
If P is greater than length + 1, ignore the insertion.
If N = 0 (initial list is empty), do not perform any insertion and print -1.

Time Complexity
Building the list takes O(N). Inserting at a specific position requires O(N) traversal.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
If N > 0, the second line contains N space-separated integers.
The next line contains two integers P (position) and X (value to insert).

Output Format
Print the DLL elements from head to end separated by space.
If the list is empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
3 99
Output:
10 20 99 30 40 50
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Position P ≥ 1
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)

hintsList: If P = 1, create a new node, link its next to old head, update head and prev pointers.
For middle positions, traverse to (P-1)th node and adjust both prev and next links.

problems.title: Delete Node in Doubly Linked List (DLL)
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Doubly Linked List (DLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to delete the node at position P (1-based index) and then display the updated DLL. If P is greater than the list length, ignore the deletion. If the list becomes empty, print -1.

Time Complexity
Deleting a node requires traversal, resulting in O(N).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
If N > 0, the second line contains N space-separated integers.
The next line contains P (position to delete).

Output Format
Print the DLL elements from head to tail separated by space. If the list becomes empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
3
Output:
10 20 40 50
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Position P ≥ 1
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)
